content:
Diagnosis
	1. Right breast adenoid cystic carcinoma
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Right wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

	Chemotherapy
	1 Mar 2024 - 15 May 2024 Weekly Paclitaxel

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Stable disease with solitary lung metastasis

	Current issues
	Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy

	Summary of consultation
	[redacted name] attended clinic today for review. She has completed 12 weeks of weekly paclitaxel. Unfortunately she has developed significant peripheral neuropathy affecting her hands and feet, impacting her daily activities. Her most recent CT scan from 20/5/24 shows stable appearance of the right lower lobe lung metastasis measuring 2.2cm (previously 2.3cm).

Given the neuropathy and achievement of disease stability, we have discussed changing treatment strategy. We will discontinue paclitaxel and commence oral capecitabine. I have explained the schedule and side effects of capecitabine, particularly hand-foot syndrome and diarrhea.

	Further investigations
	CT chest/abdomen/pelvis in 3 months

	Medication prescribed
	Capecitabine 1000mg/m2 BD D1-14 q21 days

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 weeks with blood tests

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor renal function monthly

cancer_timeline.value: Right wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
CT scan shows stable right lower lobe lung metastasis measuring 2.2cm (previously 2.3cm)
Discontinuing paclitaxel due to neuropathy, commencing capecitabine

patient_facts.value: peripheral neuropathy affecting hands and feet, impacting daily activities

status_updates.value: Right breast adenoid cystic carcinoma with stable solitary lung metastasis. Changing treatment from paclitaxel to capecitabine due to treatment-limiting neuropathy
Stable disease with lung metastasis measuring 2.2cm (previously 2.3cm)
Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy affecting hands and feet
Discontinuing paclitaxel, starting capecitabine 1000mg/m2 BD D1-14 q21 days
Review in oncology clinic in 3 weeks with blood tests
